sentences: Parties focused on the general framework, with discussions focused on procedure and the language contained in FCCC/AWGLCA/2011/CRP.38.
Some parties welcomed the language as a way forward with others describing it as totally unbalanced.
Some countries supported separating paragraph 5 as an Option 2 to avoid conflicting language in brackets.

Parties talked about how the application of common but differentiated responsibilities across sectors is both a legal and a political issue, upon which guidance must be provided and will therefore be taken up by ministers.
Some countries called for clarification on the text for international aviation and shipping before agreeing to language for the general framework.
Parties continued to consult on the way forward.
